summary: About 1.7 million people—mostly in Sub-Saharan Africa—were newly infected with HIV in 2019. The region has experienced significant population growth, including among youth, who are more vulnerable to acquiring HIV infections. The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief provided about $6 billion annually for efforts to combat HIV from FY 2015-20. We found that the program should ensure its program-level budget data is complete...
title: President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief: State Should Improve Data Quality and Assess Long-term Resource Needs
